Credibility_Assessment: Inconsistencies in testimony, narrative, and documentation
Legal_Provision: Section 96 and Section 97 of IRPA (refugee protection)
Basis_of_Claim: Persecution by a gang in Turkey
Proceeding_Type: Refugee protection hearing, followed by judicial review
Application_Error: Failure to adequately consider psychological report on memory issues
Application_Factor: Minor and peripheral inconsistencies not affecting core claim
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Rule: Credibility findings reviewed on reasonableness; inconsistencies must be rationally connected to credibility
Outcome_of_Review: Board's decision set aside, matter referred to new panel
Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived lack of credibility due to inconsistencies
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistencies in testimony and documents; unexplained omissions
Procedural_Fairness: Insufficient consideration of mental health evidence
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Application for judicial review challenging credibility assessment
Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide adequate reasons for discrediting evidence
Omission_Type: Failure to consider relevant psychological evidence
